CatDescriptText: Henry (Hank) Aaron, outfielder of the Milwaukee Braves, of Mobile, Ala, live member of the NAACP and an active NAACP campaigner, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 16, 1958, pg. 3 with question: "Do you think that Negroes are giving sufficient financial help to the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People?" Answer reads: "No, I don't. People who are able, are not giving the they that they should. Other unfortunate people would like to help but they are not able to do so.  I don't think that the organization ever will get in the place where it will have enough money."
TitMainTitle: Two men, including Milwaukee Braves baseball player Hank Aaron on right, standing on sidewalk with pedestrians and storefronts in background
